quiz.title: Unit 1: Foundations & Measurement (Quiz 12)
quiz.subtitle: Unit 1 Review - Units and Dimensional Analysis (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: The branch of Physics that deals with measurement of physical quantities is called:
questions.explanation: Metrology is the scientific study of measurement. Morphology studies form and structure, astrology is pseudoscience, chronology studies time order of events.

questions.question: The SI system of units is based on how many fundamental quantities?
questions.explanation: The SI system has 7 base quantities: mass, length, time, temperature, electric current, amount of substance, and luminous intensity.

questions.question: The SI unit of electric current is:
questions.explanation: Ampere (A) is the SI base unit for electric current. Coulomb is charge, Volt is potential, Ohm is resistance.

questions.question: In the equation $A = Bx + C$, what is $A$ known as?
questions.explanation: In the form $y = mx + c$, $y$ (here $A$) is the dependent variable - its value depends on $x$.

questions.question: A cylinder has a volume of $600\,\text{cm}^3$. If this volume is converted to cubic meters, the result is:
In the equation $A = Bx + C$, what does $C$ represent?
questions.explanation: In $y = mx + c$, $c$ (here $C$) is the $y$-intercept - the value of $A$ when $x = 0$.

questions.question: Which of the following errors is a type of systematic error?
questions.explanation: Instrumental error (faulty calibration) is systematic. Random errors are unpredictable, human and parallax errors are personal errors.

questions.question:
Consider the following scenarios:

When Ben kicks a ball, force is applied on the ball.
When Ben sits upon a chair, pressure is applied on the chair.
When Ben pushes a chair through a distance of xm, work is done on the chair.
When Ben pushes a chair through a distance in 5 seconds, power is demonstrated.
When Ben pulls a rope that is tied to a tree, stress is applied on the rope.
When Ben turns the steering wheel of a car at an angle, he applies torque to it.

Which of the following has the same dimensions as Work?
questions.explanation: Work $= ML^2T^{-2}$. Torque $= $ force $\times$ distance $= MLT^{-2} \times L = ML^2T^{-2}$. They have identical dimensions.

questions.question:
Consider the following scenarios:

When Ben kicks a ball, force is applied on the ball.
When Ben sits upon a chair, pressure is applied on the chair.
When Ben pushes a chair through a distance of xm, work is done on the chair.
When Ben pushes a chair through a distance in 5 seconds, power is demonstrated.
When Ben pulls a rope that is tied to a tree, stress is applied on the rope.
When Ben turns the steering wheel of a car at an angle, he applies torque to it.

Which of the following has the same dimensions as Pressure?
questions.explanation: Pressure $= ML^{-1}T^{-2}$. Stress $= $ force/area $= MLT^{-2}/L^2 = ML^{-1}T^{-2}$. They are dimensionally identical.

questions.question:
Consider the following scenarios:

When Ben kicks a ball, force is applied on the ball.
When Ben sits upon a chair, pressure is applied on the chair.
When Ben pushes a chair through a distance of xm, work is done on the chair.
When Ben pushes a chair through a distance in 5 seconds, power is demonstrated.
When Ben pulls a rope that is tied to a tree, stress is applied on the rope.
When Ben turns the steering wheel of a car at an angle, he applies torque to it.

Which quantity must be measured to determine if a machine is more efficient than Ben?
questions.explanation: Efficiency $= \dfrac{\text{useful power output}}{\text{total power input}} \times 100\%$. Power (rate of doing work) directly measures how quickly work is done, making it the key quantity for efficiency calculations.
